qas.question: What school publishes the Revue Biblique?
How many students does the University of Fribourg have?
When was the University of Fribourg put into the Dominican Order's care?
What is the name of one Dominican Order institution of learning?

answers.text: Pontifical University of Saint Thomas Aquinas

qas.question: What Dominican founded the Revue Thomiste?
What school does not publish the Reve Biblique?
How many students does the Monastery of Fribourg have?
What year was the University of Fribourg put into the Benedictine Order's care?
What is the name of one Benedictine Order institute of learning?
What Benedictine founded the Revue Thomiste?

context: Doctrinal development has had an important place in the restoration of the Preachers. Several institutions, besides those already mentioned, played important parts. Such is the <a0_0><b5_0>Biblical school at Jerusalem<b5_0/><a0_0/>, open to the religious of the order and to secular clerics, which publishes the Revue Biblique. The faculty of theology at the University of Fribourg, confided to the care of the Dominicans in <a2_0><b7_0>1890<b7_0/><a2_0/>, is flourishing, and has about <a1_0><b6_0>250<b6_0/><a1_0/> students. The Pontificium Collegium Internationale Angelicum, the future <a3_0><b8_0>Pontifical University of Saint Thomas<b8_0/> Aquinas<a3_0/>, Angelicum established at Rome in 1908 by Master Hyacinth Cormier, opened its doors to regulars and seculars for the study of the sacred sciences. In addition to the reviews above are the Revue Thomiste, founded by <a4_0><b9_0>Père Thomas Coconnier<b9_0/><a4_0/> (d. 1908), and the Analecta Ordinis Prædicatorum (1893). Among numerous writers of the order in this period are: Cardinals Thomas Zigliara (d. 1893) and Zephirin González (d. 1894), two esteemed philosophers; Alberto Guillelmotti (d. 1893), historian of the Pontifical Navy, and Heinrich Denifle, one of the most famous writers on medieval history (d. 1905).[citation needed]
